alert.note: Alert for York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 3:49PM EDT until August 04 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Maine, including the following county, York. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain of up to 2 inches due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Biddeford, Alfred, Sanford, Saco, Kennebunk, Buxton, Berwick, Lebanon, Hollis and Kennebunkport.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
